intervention_catalogue.name: Stepwise Emotions
intervention_catalogue.long_description:
Stepwise Emotions aims to support desistance from violent offending by enabling participants to overcome challenges such as: aggressive behaviour; thinking & behaviour related to risk of serious harm to self or others; and, attitudes related to risk of serious harm to self or others.
 Stepwise Emotions has the following features: 1. A self-monitoring/behavioural analysis mechanism; 2. insight-oriented psycho-educational content on thinking (e.g., triggers, biases), emotions (e.g., what is anger?), behaviour (e.g., aggressive/passive/assertive); 3. skills building around thinking (e.g., seeing the bigger picture), emotions (e.g., mindfulness, relaxation, time out, etc), behaviour (e.g., being assertive, dealing with criticism); 4. building social capital (e.g., social circles).
intervention_catalogue.session_detail:
1 x One-to-one session; 
 8 x group sessions

risk_consideration.cn_score_guide:
Need is evidenced by at least one of the following OASys criteria being satisfied: 
- 11.3 = 2
- Thinking & behaviour related RoSH
- Attitudes related RoSH
risk_consideration.ogrs_score_guide:
If OVP is not available, OGRS3 (over 2 years):
score of 25+

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: Participants should be sufficiently literate (able to read and understand simple sentences)

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: Check with Treatment Manager if less than 9 months
exclusion.alcohol_drug_problem_guide: Alcohol / drug problems need to be stable before attendance.
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: Those with mental health problems should only be excluded from the programme if the issues are acute and damage the individual’s ability to relate to others or concentrate
exclusion.other_preferred_method_guide: Exclude people who are eligible and suitable for an accredited programme and a place can be offered that would most likely enable completion prior to the end of sentence.
